SEARCH
Module Ordering_System
Package application.runnables

Class TableFormatter

Object
TableFormatter
public class TableFormatter extends Object
Formatter for tablular content. Content can be fitted into a table with header, separator lines and content rows.

For example: 

 +------+----------------+----------------+------------------------+
 |   ID | NAME           | FIRSTNAME      | CONTACT                |
 +------+----------------+----------------+------------------------+
 |  100 | Meyer          | Eric           | eme22@gmail.com        |
 |  101 | Tina           | Sommer         | +49 030 22458 29425    |
 |  102 | Tim            | Schulze        | +49 171 2358124        |
 +------+----------------+----------------+------------------------+
TableFormatter.builder() is used to specify an build the table, for example: 
 var tableFormatter = TableFormatter.builder()
    .columns("| ID | NAME | FIRSTNAME | CONTACT |")
    .widths(6, 16, 16, 24)    // column widths
    .alignments("R")          // column alignments
    // 
    .rowMapper(Customer.class, c ->
        new String[] {Long.toString(c.id()), c.name(), c.firstName(), c.contact())
    // 
    .build();
The table then can be filled with rows: 
 Customer c1 = new Customer(100L, "Eric", "Meyer", "eme22@gmail.com");
 Customer c2 = new Customer(101L, "Sommer", "Tina", "+49 030 22458 29425");
 Customer c3 = new Customer(102L, "Schulze", "Tim", "+49 171 2358124");
 // 
 // print 'Customer' table
 tableFormatter
    .header()
        .row(c1)
        .row(c2)
        .row(c3)
    .footer()
    .print(System.out);
Uses lombok's @Builder pattern.

      public TableFormatter line(String... markers)

    • row

      public TableFormatter row(Object mappedObject, Boolean... seperatorLine)
      Format object as row in the table using a rowMapper registered for the object class. Example: 
       |  100 | Meyer          | Eric           | eme22@gmail.com        |
      Parameters:
      mappedObject - object mapped to a row
      seperatorLine - append optional seperator line
      Returns:
      chainable self-reference

    • row

      public TableFormatter row(String... values)
      Format row from values putting the i-th value into the i-th column.
      • value: "text" put text in cell with separators,
      • value: " " format empty cell with separators,
      • value: "" format empty cell with no separators.
      Markers can prepend values:
      • value: "{label}" format cell with column label with separators,
      • value: "{---}" fill cell as dashed-line with "+" separators,
      • value: "{R}text" format cell with right alignment with no separators,
      • value: "{R }text" format cell with right alignment with separators,
      • value: "{L}text", "{L }text" accordingly with left alignment.
      Parameters:
      values - to output as row
      Returns:
      chainable self-reference

    • print

      public void print(OutputStream os)
      Terminal method to print internal buffer to OutputStream and clear internal buffer.
      Parameters:
      os - OutputStream as destination for buffer content

    • test

      public static TableFormatter test()
      Test method that prints some table content: 
       +------+----------------+----------------+------------------------+
 |   ID | NAME           | FIRSTNAME      | CONTACT                |
 +------+----------------+----------------+------------------------+
 |  100 | Meyer          | Eric           | eme22@gmail.com        |
 |  101 | Sommer         | Tina           | +49 030 22458 29425    |
 |  102 | Schulze        | Tim            | +49 171 2358124        |
 |  103 | Brinkmann      | Tobias         | +49 030 662465724      |
 +------+----------------+----------------+------------------------+
                                   total: |                      4 |
                                          +------------------------+
 +------+                                                           
        +----------------+                                          
                         +----------------+                         
                                          +------------------------+
 | A    |                                                           
        | B              |                                          
                         | C              |                         
                                          | D                      |
   A                                                                
          B                                                         
                           C                                        
                                            D                       
   A      B                C                D
      Returns:
      TableFormatter instance that prints some table content.
